text: It’s FULL. THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE stand in SHOCK and SILENCE staring up at the trademark GIANT ASTROVISION TV SCREEN.
And now, one of our own has joined them. Taking up arms against the forces of evil. Here... and everywhere.
ON THE SCREEN: A weathered, GREYING MAN (60’s) whom we’1l come to know as PIPE. He’s at the end of a press conferen three seconds from changing the world:
One of us. Now one of them. (then) A Green Lantern. SMASH TO BLACK.
Jim says there’s gonna be thousands of people here today.
It's an air show. Not the Superbowl. The blackness parts, revealing DAYLIGHT. We're in:
Two massive doors split, pushed by MARTIN JORDAN and his HAL (12). We’re immediately jealous of their connection.
Does it completely freak you out? All those people coming to watch you fly?
Naah. It’s not me they’re coming to see. It’s this... The FLUORESCENTS FLICKER on, revealing a fourth generatio style JET, the RAMJET. Hal races toward it.
Sweet. When can I take her up?
When you’re big enough to get in the cockpit without my help.
Mr. Ferris lets me use the simulator. I’m getting pretty killer.
Carol lets you use the sim. If her pop knew he'd kill you both. Martin lifts Hal up onto the wing.
Does it bother you that Mom doesn’t come watch you fly?
It’s not me flying planes she has a problem with. It’s me testing them.
So... why do you?

Someone’s gotta be first, Hal. The concern in Hal’s look draws Martin closer to his son. MARTIN JORDAN (CONT’D) Someday, if your brothers let you live long enough, you're gonna be an adult. And you’re gonna make a million choices. Like where to live. What kinda car to drive. Who your friends are. But every now and then, if you’re really lucky, something chooses you. When that happens, there’s no fighting it. Your mother might not agree with what I do, but she understands that much. Martin watches the concept sink in with Hal. Then:
So... Wanna checkout the cockpit? (Hal leaps up) Wait. You’re gonna need this. Martin strips off his bomber jacket, places it on Hal. Th call sign “SABRE” on the chest. As Hal gets in:
You think Mom will understand if I’m chosen to be a Samurai?
She’s handled worse.

WE'RE SOARING over open fields, CARS lined up eight rows deep. LOCALS sit on hoods and roofs. A BANNER shouts: “TH FERRIS AIR SPECTACULAR - A 5-YEAR TRADITION!!!” A DEAFENING CHEER erupts as the RAMJET BUZZES the field.
Hal (still in the bomber jacket) turns from the glass --
That must’ve been Mach-Two! CAROL FERRIS (12), a few years and orthodontist visits aw from growing into her looks, steps beside him. She does h best to hide a blossoming crush.
Mach-Three. When’re you gonna learn how to read a sonic boom? (then, notices) Nice jacket. Does it come any bigger?
Nice braces. Do they come any brighter? Hal crosses to a BOTTLE of chilled DOM.
Mr. Ferris, can I crack her open? Amidst a half-DOZEN ADULTS stands an imposing CARL FERRIS (40's). He dons a rare smile. Into his headset:
Tower to Sabre. Your son wants to know if you’re done showing off and we can get this party started.
Roger that, Tower. Tell my son I said two fingers worth for him and that’s it.

(to Hal You heard him, Hal. Knock it out. Hal’s about to do that when... BOOM! And not the sonic ki AN_EXPLOSION. Hal races to the window. The RAMJET SPIRALS through the air, leaving a CORKSCREW of BLACK SMOKE.
Tower, I got a flameout in the starboard engine. Over.
She can’t fly on one engine. Eject.
Can’t do it, Tower. The jet’ll go straight into the crowd.
Sabre, get outta that plane! Now!
I’m pushing her to the runway first! Carol turns to Hal, but Hal is half-way out the room. We FOLLOW HAL DOWN THE STAIRS, bounding two at a time.
It’s too far away, Martin!
I can do it! Sabre, I said EJECT!  5.

I’m clear. Ejecting now -- Sabre, I’m ordering you to eject now! An EARTH SHATTERING CRASH as Hal flies out of the buildin Carol is right after him, watching Hal frantically search PLUME of BLACK SMOKE in the distance.
Where is it? Where’s his ‘chute?
Hal...

Where’s his ‘chute?! Carol looks at him, heartbroken. GO SLOW MO as Hal, losin it, tries to run toward the crash site but an OLDER BOY (JIM), grabs hold of him. We gaze down at the DEVASTATION. Amongst the flames and metal, the SHATTERED COCKPIT tells us everything we need know. We FOLLOW the rush of SMOKE into the blue sky. HIGH and FASTER. MUSIC BUILDS. Then the pitch black of:

A SHIP SHRIEKS BY -- a small, otherworldly SPACECRAFT. INT. ABIN SUR’S SPACECRAFT A complex NAVIGATION DISPLAY. Operating it is the craft’s pilot: ABIN SUR. Noble features. Magenta skin. Abin’s RING FLICKERS and a HOLOGRAM in GREEN LIGHT appears. It’s prissy fin-headed fishman, TOMAR-RE. VIA RING:
You could have been there and back by now if you’d gone by ring.
Markot deserves the proper return home. It is not often a Lantern falls. In a corner, a METALLIC COFFIN.
What will you tell them about how he was lost?
All that we know. He was overpowered in the service of protecting his sector.
And that three Lanterns were slaughtered before him --
There’s no cause to spread fear. A BUMP makes his ship LURCH -- the nav system GOES OUT.
If you insist on traveling by ship, Abin, at least learn to operate one.
We've been friends a long time, Tomar-Re. Perhaps one day I’1l understand why. The hologram shuts off. Abin’s RING PULSES. He is instant enveloped in a BRILLIANT GREEN AURA.

Abin, protected by that aura, FLOATS OUTSIDE his ship. He takes a moment to appreciate the view... a ballet of 63 MOONS, rotating around... SATURN. Small universe. Abin surveys his ship’s hull. He floats toward a BROKEN DISH. As he does, a FLASH BEHIND HIM -- a GOLD BLUR. Abin doesn’t see it. But we do. Abin’s Ring creates TOOLS to fix the dish (the Ring just cooler and cooler). The FLASH BEHIND HIM comes round agai This time Abin sees its GOLD LIGHT. He turns to see -- A MASSIVE CREATURE blocking out the Sun. The size of a WH with tentacles of an OCTOPUS and a SHARK’S KILLER GRIN. T is LEGION. And we fear it.

(holy fuckshit) Great Krona -- Abin FIRES A FULL FORCE RINGBLAST AT LEGION! Everything h ring has, deployed in one massive, magnificent pulse. But nothing happens! His ring didn’t work on Legion -- wh fires forth A SERIES OF GOLD BLASTS. Abin’s ring calls up GREEN SHIELD deflecting the incoming fire. Barely. Legion’s tentacles LASH OUT, grabbing Abin and curling hi to the YELLOW FANGS of its DRIPPING MAW. Abin summons a huge GREEN HAND, grabs a passing ASTEROID sends it RAMMING -- SMASH -- INTO LEGION. Legion drops Ab buying him enough time to climb back into -- INT. ABIN SUR’S SHIP - CONTINUOUS Abin slams down the controls so that the ship’s GUNS FIRE

The force sends Legion flying back -- and propels Abin’s ahead... BURSTING THROUGH ONE OF SATURN’S RINGS! Legion i lost in the distance. Abin looks to a GAPING WOUND in his side. A PURPLISH STAI colors his uniform, Struggling for consciousness, Abin’s Ring generates a beam of light.

This is Abin Sur, chosen protector of Sector 2814. I have seen what hunts us... Legion... it lives. The Ring holds no effect, no defense -- You must take action. Legion is real. (a raspy gasp, then) I have escaped... but not with my life. I shall proceed to the nearest sentient planet for selection.

REVEAL what he’s aiming for: Some 820 million miles away. . Our comforting, familiar blue home. As Abin’s ship straightens to find its course we DISSOLVE TO... ANOTHER SPACESHIP? No, it just looks like a spaceship. It actually the SABRE JET, the latest brainchild of Carl Fer
Pilots are obsolete. We're watching the Sabre as it’s put through its paces on VIDEO playing on ALL FIVE FLATSCREEN DISPLAYS in:
Smart and modern. Models of the SABRE in various design stages. CAROL FERRIS, braces long gone and replaced with MBA, mesmerizes A FEW SUITS and TWO GENERALS.

I know conventional wisdom says planes can’t think like people. And I know conventional wisdom says U-CAVs aren’t ready for mass deployment. That the tech isn’t there yet. (beat) Conventional wisdom is for followers. Ferris Air is about to make all aerial combat missions unmanned. Today. The SUITS look intrigued -- except for one, who speaks wi the confidence of a former astronaut, current SENATOR.
And what do you expect all those pilots we spent thirteen billion taxpayer dollars training to do?
If our skies are safer and their lives protected... I expect them to thank me.
Then you don’t know pilots, Ms. Ferris.

Enough to know pilots like you are few and far between, Senator. Most aren’t four-star NASA icons. Most pilots are far more human than that. There are pilots who are cocky... Pilots who are irresponsible... CLOSE ON: A WELL-WORN BOMBER JACKET on a floor. If it loo familiar it should. It’s the one Hal’s father gave him.
And pilots who are both.
PAN to the bed and UP the INTERTWINED LEGS of JENNA, a yo toned hottie, and... HAL JORDAN. 15 years older and not a that much more mature.
Now I remember why yoga’s my second favorite thing in life.
Yeah? What’s the first?
Yoga instructors. It’s a photo finish with flying.
(they kiss, then) . And what was that little maneuver called again?

A Split-S. Also known as an Immelmann Turn. Dangerous stuff. It should only be performed by a certified professional. The sound of a CAR pulling in interrupts their good time. Then a DOORSLAM. Jenna sits up sharply. Not good.
Oh no -- he’s early.
Who's early? Jenna starts throwing clothes at Hal, a mile a minute --
i

Okay, so remember after we did those shots how I said how weird it was that Tibet was your favorite place in the world too and I broke up with my boyfriend because he wouldn’t ever go with me and you were so my type --
Yeah, I may have exaggerated my enthusiasm for Far East travel --
That's okay. I may have exaggerated how much I broke up with my boyfriend.
And he’s here? (she nods, he is) Now? Yep. Hal takes a glance out the window -- and sees her MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND walking towards the house.
You’re sure that’s just one guy... Hal puts his pants on both legs at once, as --
It comes down to fear...
All pilots are susceptible. It’s a human instinct. Train them for years, spend billions, you can’t get rid of it. And it’s fear that causes mistakes.
Hal is out the window, pulling on his clothes, when he spots... HIS BOMBER JACKET. Still on the floor. Inside, Jenna fends off her boyfriend’s suspicions.
I texted you all night, babe. Where were you?
I taught a late Bikram class. The steam made my phone all sweaty. He’s about to believe the lie when he turns to find -- Ha reaching in to retrieve his bomber jacket. Busted.
Forgot this. Don’t let me interrupt you. And Hal TAKES OFF -- up the fire escape -- as --
End of the day, pilots are only human.
Carol leads the SUITS into the ultra-modern hangar where even more ultra modern jet rests. A SABRE PROTOTYPE.
Whereas the Sabres are more than human. Each has SAR/MTI and EO/IR sensors which feed into a sub-symbolic neural net. These aren’t drones. They’re the chess machine that can beat the grandmaster.
Our pilots live for combat, Ms. Ferris. No machine can compete with the fire we put in our boys.
In that case... maybe you’d be willing to suit up and fly against them in our demonstration. The Senator decides to LAUGH it off. CARL FERRIS, himself older and crankier, sidles up to Carol. Sotto:
Explain how pissing off the guy with the government checkbook gets us closer to congressional funding.
I can handle him Dad. You worry about getting a backup pilot. You’re still missing your third.
He'11 show.
Really? Because I’m running out of shpiel and looking at an empty F-16.
I’ve been preparing for this day for fifteen years, I know what I’m doing.
There are better pilots out there than Hal Jordan. Who show up.
We don’t need better pilots. We need the ones who’1ll make the Sabre look good. Carol clocks her father’s savvy. Checks her watch.
Three, two, one...  11. As they exit the hangar doors to the tarmac, on perfect c A SABRE BUZZES clean over all their heads!
Gentlemen... the future of flying.
Hal FLIES across the rooftops, reminding himself:
Next time, down the fire escape. A glance backward. JENNA’S BOYFRIEND is gaining. And homicidal. Hal whips out his cellphone as he runs.
(into phone) Hey. It’s me. I need a favor... I’m running a little late. With that Hal LEAPS off the roof’s edge. As he’s mid-flig we MATCH CUT TO: A 1967 MUSTANG CONVERTIBLE skidding to a dead stop.
Hal gets out as his best friend TOM KALMAKU (late 20's) R UP, carrying a flight suit. Tom’s part Eskimo, all dedica nerdling. Hal snags the suit, putting it on as they walk.
They didn’t start yet, did they?
No. ‘Cause they’re waiting. For you.
Nice how everything works out.
Tom and Hal round the corner toward the JETS. Carol is coming at them. Tom suddenly shifts course away.
Where are you going?
To the tower. She scares me.
You’re late.
And your candy machine’s out of those peanut butter crackers. A guy skips lunch because he makes certain assumptions about snack availability.
We’re making history with the Sabre today -- not even you can ruin my mood.
Nice name by the way. Sabre. I’m sure your dad gave himself a good bonus pat on the back for that one.
It’s in your father’s honor, Hal.
My father would’ve hated it. It’s a piece of metal, with an X-Box for a brain. It’ll never replace a pilot.
It’s beaten most of them already. He climbs up and into his jet. As he does:
Hasn’t beaten me. How about, if I win, we go down to the riverbed and recreate a little night I like to call Junior Prom?
It wasn’t a night, more like three minutes.
Then make it dinner. You, me, lobster, your company card.
We'll see how hungry you are after you get your ass kicked. Fly safe.
Never learned how. Hal watches her go. A sight he’ll never get over...
A 360 degree view of the sky. ON TOM at the CONTROL STATI headset on. Carol takes her place beside him. The General and Carl arc around. Into his headset:
Gentlemen, you are about to engage the fearsome and mighty Sabre U-CAV. I wrote half the code on ‘em myself, so I should warn you...
The THREE F-16s LINE UP. ACROSS FROM THEM on the other si of the runway, the THREE SABRES line up opposite.
This is gonna suck hard for you. MUSIC RISES, POUNDING LOUDER as the JET ENGINES flare... and... THE SIX PLANES take off! WE INTERCUT WITH:
A LIGHTING-FAST 3-ON-3 DOGFIGHT over the California FOOTHILLS. Hal breaks formation, going after one of the Sabres. He’s more than a pilot, he’s a natural. A sharp left and Hal’s got one CROSSHAIRED.

Tower, this is Highball, I’d like to report a yawn fast approaching. Hal’s missile lock CHIMES, but the Sabre DIVES in a phenomenal, physics-shattering move. Dammit if the Sabre isn’t pursuing Hal now.
You didn’t mention they could teleport.

(to the Suits) The Sabres utilize the same targeting algorithms as your current U-CAVs, but the flying protocols are as close to human-grade as you can get... Hal's F-16 TEARS down towards the other two -- which are struggling in their own dogfight with Sabres 2 & 3. A LAS SPRAYS from Sabre 2, TARGET LOCKING right onto an F-16's tail. What are you feeding those things?

For those keeping score, it’s now three against one. ALL THREE SABRES target Hal now. Hal pulls every move he think of -- SKIMMING THE TREES -- HUGGING the GROUND -- b nothing works. They’re flies on shit.

The Sabres are programmed to perform every flight maneuver within known parameters. The Sabres stream closer... TARGETING... he’s a split-sec from toast when HAL SUDDENLY YANKS his throttle! His F-16 CLIMBS MANIACALLY FAST. The THREE SABRES fly hard after h

These things are programmed within known parameters... thought I’d try out the other kind.
Tom reads the screen, so does Carol. JUh oh.
He’s taking them into -- i
A coffin corner. Can they follow?
They don’t know not to. We never accounted for self-destructive behavior. |

The altitude where a plane’s stall speed equals its Mach.
If a plane hits it... it stalls out. Carol grabs Tom’s headset. Pissed and a little scared:
Hal, the F-16 you’re flying is a nineteen million dollar aircraft --
It’s insured, right?
You're not. You won’t have enough oxygen up there! You’ll pass out! WARNING LIGHTS FLASH as the unimaginable G-FORCES overtak Hal. The SABRES are still right up his ass.
I'll wake up. |  15.
Pull out! Now, dammit! Hal’s F-16 is a SPACE SHUTTLE barrelling the UPPER ATMOSPHERE. The Sabres start to SHUDDER -- but Hal has a harder time breathing. He RIPS off his MASK.
I’m losing Sabres Alpha and Beta. Make that Alpha, Beta and Gamma! The Sabres’ engines GO OUT. Another STALLS. As they all become $100 million ROCKS and PLUMMET to the Earth.
What just happened?
The Sabres followed Hal into a stall but because they’re unmanned, they can’t restart their own engines.
Almost makes you wish you had a cocky pilot flying them, Ms Ferris.

(to Tom, defeated) Trigger a manual restart. The Sabres RESTART to return safely. But Hal is STILL CLIMBING. He begins to lose consciousness. A QUICK SERIES of FLASH CUTS: Young Hal watching his father’s plane tumbling from the sky... the BLAZE and HOR of the WRECKAGE itself. CLOSE ON HAL -- HE BLACKS OUT as his own engines FLICKER
Hal just lost his engines.
Hal! Wake up Hal! But Hal is out. His plane begins to FREEFALL TO EARTH! SPINNING WILDLY -- end over end with the SUN FLASHING in eyes as we TUMBLE WITH HIM --
Dammit Hal, wake up! Carol (and the rest of us) have almost lost all hope when FOOM. The F-16’s engines COME TO LIFE, blossoming with light. The plane FIRES AHEAD, PEALING RIGHT OVER THE GROU
Hal smiles, rubs his eyes like he never had a doubt.
Well... that was easy.
Carol beelines for Hal, as he steps off his plane.
How stupid are you?!

Um, “Amazing moves there, Hal. You sure know your way around a Thatch Weave...” Hal spots Carl walking the Generals to their car. after them, a young man’s fury: HAL (CONT’D) If you’re gonna take jobs away from pilots, you better do it with something that can pull out of a stall!
You almost got yourself killed! And for what? To spite my father? (then) After all the times I stood up for you, the one day I needed you to come through.

I know why he wanted me here today. He thought I’d be an easy target. Sorry if I disappointed. 16. He shouts She wishes she could fire him -- but she just can’t. Ther too much history there, too much... everything.
You’re grounded. Permanently. You want to see another jet, come to the air show. Carol goes to leave. Hal calls after her, payback:
So I'm thinking like eight tomorrow. You come by my place, we have a drink first. I’m going casual but you should wear that little blue cocktail dress -- (Carol turns) The bet. Remember?
(you’re so fucked) If you’ll excuse me, I have to go call your mother. Back on Hal, the first sign of fear in his eyes...
Abin’s ship shoots into Earth’s atmosphere at destructive speeds -- a dead weight SPIRALLING -- FLARING UP with the immense heat so hot, pieces of it MELT away --
TWO KIDS play with their TOY SPACESHIPS -- SOMEHOW they d notice THE REAL SPACESHIP STREAKING ACROSS THE SKY OVERHE

Seconds before the ship hits, the GREEN LIGHT surrounding focuses to the fore, as it CRASHES! DRIVING DEEP INTO THE GROUND! Dust flies... then settles. Then all goes quiet. No sign of life. The wind picks up. A THIN SNAKE OF SMOKE rises, set against the unkind sun. FOLLOW THE SMOKE DOWN TO... A FRESH CRATER IN THE EARTH. CLOSE ON: A CAPILLARY LINE of PURPLE BLOOD dripping betwe rocks. Follow the trickle to: A MAGENTA-HUED HAND. It’s ABIN’S. The wreckage crushing him. He looks to his ring.
(barely a whisper) Someone honest, someone brave... As if understanding, the RING GLIMMERS, then SPINS, becom a SPHERE OF GREEN LIGHT. Which RISES UP into the sky.

FOLLOW THE SPHERE as it FLIES AROUND THE PLANET at fantas speed. A streak of light. Seeking something... or SOMEONE It crosses the DESERT... over the SUNSET STRIP and all th CRUISING DRIVERS... Picking up speed as it DOES A COMPLET CIRCUIT AROUND THE WORLD, buzzing (UNSEEN) past THOUSANDS PEOPLE... faces OLD and YOUNG... PAST SOLDIERS and FARMER and BUSINESSMEN... bypassing CONGRESS entirely... PAST A GLASSES-WEARING REPORTER at THE DAILY PLANET... OVER A COLLEGE FOOTBALL FIELD and a COACH with the name “GARDNER” on his jersey (obscuring a hero we’ll meet in t second film), the GREEN LIGHT CIRCLES him TWICE, deciding then SUDDENLY SENSES SOMETHING ELSE... As it BOLTS OFF...

I came back for you. Listen. You don’t know if Mom knows, too, do you? Hal’s mother, HELEN JORDAN (50’s) heads over. Her natural beauty almost covers the tragedy behind her eyes. Almost. The smile converts into a death glare.

Your instructor. Killowog. The GLs suddenly go FLYING in all directions, having been thrown off by KILLOWOG, a gargantuan rhino-creature. He lumbers over. Looks down on Hal from ten feet high --
So you're the Poozer from 2814. (sniffs) You smell funny. (leans in close, heheheh) We’re gonna have fun training you. We're not sure if Hal will ever speak again.
The Ring’s power comes from the Central Battery.
High atop an opaline plinth stands THE CENTRAL BATTERY (f our opening). Majestic. Enormous. CRACKLING with energy.

It fuels every lantern, which in turn fuels every ring. LANTERNS fly around and up to it, charging their rings wi the formality of the righteous on pilgrimage to holy grou FIND Hal and Sinestro below, minute in comparison.
So this is what makes all that... green.
Green... the light you see, is only a manifestation of what your mind cannot comprehend.
You lost me at “manifestation.”

All life is connected. By love, by hope, by all the noblest instincts of the soul. This is the center of that connection. The power drawn from that connection is what you see simply as “green.” (gestures to the Battery) All that power... collected, channeled, here delivered. Entrusted to us. We can tell Hal is daunted by the grandeur of it all.

Come, let us pay our respects. Sinestro motions toward a waiting LINE of LANTERNS. All manner of CREATURES assembled before a MAGENTA-SKINNED WO Abin’s widow, LIANA. Regal in her sadness. She sees them approach. Breaking ceremony she goes straight to Hal.
You bear my husband's ring. Hal doesn’t know how to answer.
You saw him. You were with Abin Sur when he died.
Yes.
A thousand years together and a thousand more taken from us. Hal can see the pain of loss. He knows it too well.
He told me... to tell you he loved you. With his last breath. These words give her more comfort than the hundreds of we wishers. She restrains a well-spring of emotion.
You wear the ring of a fine soldier. There are many who will miss him. Even more who owe him thanks. Do it justice.
As Hal and Sinestro re-enter, Hal studies the Battery clo now. A mixture of emotions cascading over him.
You lied to her and think it kind. You are human.  45. Hal TOUCHES the base wall of the Battery, as he does his FLICKERS. A HOLOGRAM manifests, a rotating CORPS SYMBOL.
Um... is it supposed to do that?

A fallen Lantern will sometimes dictate a final transmission, to reveal itself before the Central Battery -- Sinestro waits. The logo FLICKERS into the face of... LEGION! Ferociously ATTACKING ABIN! We’re re-watching Abin’s spacefight with Legion as a GIANT GREEN HOLOGRAM. ABIN SUR’S VOICE This is Abin Sur -- I have seen what hunts us -- Legion -- it lives --

Sinestro stands beside Hal, projecting Abin’s message for GUARDIANS to see. The horrible hologram REPLAYS on a loop ABIN SUR’S VOICE The ring holds no effect, no defense -- You must take action. Legion is real.
“Legion is real.” The dying words of our most noble soldier. He points to the image of the snarling hellbeast.
Legion -- taking its revenge for offenses long forgotten to all but itself... And ou, the Guardians of our Universe.
What is it you desire, Thaal Sinestro?
A Golden Light to match Legion’s. If our enemies command such power, we must too!
It is agreed action must be taken.
Gather your Lanterns. Seek the beast out and contain it.
Return with Legion defeated. And we will consider your request. Sinestro is far from sated with their answer.
We have faith in you, Thaal Sinestro. And in the Lanterns at your side. Hal takes one last look at Legion... which is currently ROARING in his face, as we HARD CUT TO:
Hal storms out, moving somewhere, anywhere --
We were given leave to find Legion.
You were. I’m going home. If you’re ever near Gaia, pop over, we'll grab a drink.
You are a member of the Corps now. You took an oath.
I recited a poem floating in my apartment! It doesn’t make that giant Spacemonster my problem.
The Ring chose you, Hal.
The Ring made a mistake!
Rings do not make mistakes. Lanterns do.

And I’d make a million of ‘em. Trust me. (then, re: his Ring) Look, I had a good life before this showed up. Before rhino instructors and purple widows, who quite frankly made me feel really guilty. This whole alien army deal... it’s not my thing.

Legion was in your sector, Hal. In your home system. If any trace of that demon fell to your planet along with Abin... it will ravage your homeworld like a cancer. A look crosses Hal’s face. Is it worry? He catches himsel

Hal’‘s on a PLATFORM. Tomar-Re and Sinestro instruct him.
Leaving? Well, the Ring adheres to your will. “Simply will yourself home.
Where do I FedEx it when I’m done?
The Ring has selected you. It is yours until you fall in battle. Or elsewhere. (a little grim) We await your return, Hal Jordan. Hal gives a nervous look -- then LIGHTING UP IN HIS GREEN

Architecture that exudes the dependability our leaders do

Sign here, Senator. INT. SENATOR’S OFFICE - DAY Capacious, complete with an “ego wall.” We recognize the behind the battleship-sized desk as the SENATOR from our opening Sabre demo. An AIDE waits as the Senator finishes signing some docume Hector waits nearby, less patient.

Sorry to make you wait.
No problem, Dad. Not like I’ve got anything better to do. And we realize this is SENATOR HAMMOND. Hector’s father. produces a TICKET clipped to a FLIER.
Here. Ferris fields in Coast City. They invited me to fly -- a slab of butter to get me to sign off on a huge appropriations request. But any chance to show I’ve still got some moves.
(off the flier) An air show? I didn’t know they still had these.
(getting to it) So. Your lab called. You haven’t shown up for work in days.
Just taking some personal time. Trust me, my boss knows all about it. Hector concentrates, reading his father’s thoughts:

Another job you’ll be fired from. Hector tries to hide his pain -- the pain of confirming w he’s always suspected his father thought about him. SENATOR HAMMOND (V.O.) (CONT’D) All of life’s opportunities, and you’re such a disappointment. (the final knife) How is it possible you’re my son?
Hector turns away, trying to hide his torment. Spits out
Air show and truancy. Did we cover everything?
Since you’re on vacation, maybe you can make it tomorrow? The Senator claps Hector on the shoulder, demonstrating t limit of his affection.
Wouldn’t miss it, Dad. You know how I love to watch you fly.

A KH-10 SATELLITE floats into view. WE HEAR A WARP SPEED WHOOSH accompanied by a GREEN FLASH as -- HAL COMES OUT of warp speed, inelegantly SKIDDING to a st like it’s his first day on a snowboard. He looks down to the vomit-inducing view of the Earth.
(to the Ring) Good... space-flying, Ring. But home is a little further -- And Hal bullets to Farth. The Satellite toddles in his wa HAL (CONT’D) -- dooocowwwwwwwwnnnnnn...
Where is he? It’s two in the afternoon.
Where Carol lays into Tom --
That’s late even by Hal standards. Behind Carol, HAL DESCENDS in full uniform. She misses it but Tom gets a full on holy shit view of Hal’s landing.
Um, I think he just pulled up. Carol turns to follow Tom’s gaze... but Hal’s uniform recrystalizes back into his regular clothes.
Hey, Carol. Sorry about last night. I kinda had to... take off --
Save it. I’m sure wherever you had to go was more interesting. Carol storms out. Hal shakes his head. Tom is slackjawed.
You did not just fly here.
A wide variety of VINTAGE AIRCRAFT are lined up. Delta Wings, F-16Cs, Warbirds, etc. Carol marches past them, he still full of steam, as Hal races to catch up --
Carol... How can you walk so fast in heels? Carol, I’d explain but --

It’s not hard to figure out. We had our first serious conversation in years and your 12 year-old brain couldn’t take it so you bolted. By this point, they've arrived at a trio of F-16C FIGHTIN FALCONS. Three PILOTS descend, one from each cockpit.
What're the Three Douches doing here?
The air show’s tomorrow. They’re making sure the Senator’s F-16 is flight-ready.
You're letting that geezer in a Falcon?
Well, that wasn’t exactly Plan A, but it turns out one of my pilots screwed the pooch on the flight demo. Meaning Hal. Who looks over the line of aircraft, eager.
So which one of these bad boys is mine?

Well, let’s see... Not this one. Or this one. Not this one either... That’s the thing about being grounded, you stay on the ground. Gas ‘em up. She walks off. The Douches CRACK UP. Hal shakes his head, can’t win... then spots a way for his day to get worse:
his beloved MUSTANG hangs from a tow truck. A corpse. Hal walks to it. Tom approaches. He flips Hal the Mustang KEY
i
You’re welcome by the way -- nine hour drive to Arizona, no big deal. No reason to reward that kinda loyalty by maybe telling me what the hell happened to you.
I went to their home planet. The less said about the whole thing the better. Hal deposits the Ring in the beat-up GLOVE COMPARTMENT.

(as Hal walks off) That’s fine. Keep it to yourself. I’m sure there’s absolutely nothing cool about aliens in outer space. SMASH TO: THOUSANDS of LANTERNS. Some big, some small, so furry -- but you wouldn’t want to fuck with any of them.
An enormous COLISEUM under a star-flecked sky. The meetin hall of the Corps. Sinestro stands before THOUSANDS, his ring conjures IMAGES of FOUR LANTERNS overhead.

Fellow Lanterns. Today we mourn the loss of our finest. Four of our brethren struck down by a single terror: Legion. The four images converge into ONE larger IMAGE OF LEGION. SINESTRO (CONT’D) Do not deny the truth of your own eyes. Legion is no myth. This image comes from the ring of Abin Sur himself. Proof of the unthinkable: The Lost Sector has been breached. Legion roams free. And it has a taste for your death. Alone we cannot defeat it. But we are not one Lantern. (a warrior'’s cry) We! Are! THE CORPS! CHEERS erupt. Sinestro ring conjures his trademark scimit Other Lanterns also conjure their own individual weaponry
Together... our light shines with the will of all that lives. Together we will search every star in every sector of the Universe until our enemy is within our grasp! And together --
More CHEERS as LANTERNS shoot off the planet and in the direction of their 3600 sectors. Lighting up the night sk
-- We Will Be Victorious! As SINESTRO himself shoots TOWARD CAMERA. KRAK-KOOM! A SONIC BOOM quakes. WIPING US TO --

Inner ear infection. They WALK PAST the huge STAGE in front of the bleachers. audience erupts with APPLAUSE as SENATOR HAMMOND strides the stairs and into one of the F-16C Falcons we saw earli

HECTOR WATCHES. A piece of popcorn floats neatly into his mouth. He smiles, taking his place in the stands...

i

Butter knife.

split out of their three-man formation. Hal shakes his he disapproving. Back to Nathan: HAL (CONT’D) See that? They should’a been at ninety degrees before coming out of formation.

is fighting his controls now. They’ve jammed on him.
grins, enjoying this. The first time in his life he’s controlled his father.

grows EVER LARGER in frame, casting a SHADOW over the CRO BACK WITH HAL -- as HE RIPS the compartment open! STAY ON HIS FACE to see it BATHED in that BRILLIANT GREEN LIGHT.. It’s time.

as it skids gently onto the tarmac. THE GREEN NET tape measures back into GL’s Ring. But there’s no time to celebrate as he BLAZES towards the tower.

Uncle-Hal-oh-my-god-did-you-see-it-was-so cool-there-was-a-flying-guy-who-came- in-- whoosh--with-this-kickass-green-suit-and-- ptchoo-ptchoo--shot-laser-beams-out-of his-fist --

Hal walks downstairs to find his mother, watching the new

Super-hero, Mom.

They might look different... but these are his brothers. PUSH IN ON HAL, as -- He takes off the fallen Lantern’s ring. And does the same thing with the others!

Glass and metal rain down as LEGION’S CLAWS explode throu the outer wall! The monster wrenches its way out of captivity, like a demon hatching from a egg. EVERY AVAILABLE LANTERN mobilizes -- Kilowog and Tomar-Re the CADETS -- all swarming like hornets, conjuring all ma of weapons and blasts, all useless, as --

In unison, the Lanterns CRISSCROSS the sky with weblike- BEAMS. Legion SWATS LANTERNS ASIDE, PULSES EXPLODING from its jaws! Lanterns fall and die, making a hole in the sky cover. Legion is about to escape through it -- when -- A SCIMITAR SLICES OFF ONE OF ITS CLAWS. SINESTRO stands in its way. His four blades swinging. Valiant, but no match for Legion. In an instant, Sinestro grabbed. Legion enjoys a moment of delight... about to ta his head off in its endless fangs when --

WIELDING A POWER RING ON EACH FINGER! A master of ten Rin

Yeah. I really need more training. Hal’s Rings conjure up an army of objects -- SAMURAI SWOR ASSORTED WEAPONRY -- anything he can think of to distract Legion from the others. He succeeds -- Legion has a taste for only his blood now... And RACES for Hal! Bait taken..

Hal flies fast, leading Legion away -- slaloms and twists weaving around the towers that rocket past. Legion just SMASHES through them. Pursuing relentlessly. Hal rockets HIGHER -- where SINESTRO flies to his side -- matching his speed. Hal couldn’t be happier for the help.

Glad you could make it. Together they FIRE an arsenal of GREEN WEAPONS that work elegant SEQUENCE to whittle away at Legion’s strength. We see in these two the makings of a legendary team. But Legion is only scuffed, not stopped. Sinestro and Hal barely dodge an EXPLOSIVE PULSE that takes out a BUILDING
(yelling) Am I allowed to kill him yet?!
No number of rings will be enough to slay Legion.
I wasn’t gonna use the Rings! Hal loops around a DOME. Legion SWIPES, CRACKING THE DOME WIDE OPEN -- REVEALING, inside --

Crackling with infinite power. He flies right for it -- FIRING AHEAD! RIGHT INTO THE BATTERY! We start to get the idea that Hal has a plan. And it’s a dumb one. He FIRES again -- right into the core -- which starts to GLOW, a nuclear bomb arming itself... Growing LOUDER and LOUDER until we feel its power surging... OVERLOADING! LIGHTNING FIRES ALL AROUND! STRIKING HAL! But he holds hi fire INTO the Battery.
Get out now! You'll die.

(straining) Just promise you’ll help my people! Sinestro nods. He will. Hal, made braver by that promise. FIRES ONE LAST TIME -- INTO THE BATTERY -- which PULSES - and ROILS -- until... it... finally gives out --

A GREEN DETONATION like the Big Bang itself, traveling... STRAIGHT THROUGH HAL. Coursing through his body! It’s too much! Hal holds it together just long enough to bring his hands together -- channelling all that endless energy to --

text: A RINGLBLAST THE LIKES OF WHICH GOD HAS NEVER SEEN! The combined power of all life expended at once. So much ener the RINGS ON HIS HAND DISINTEGRATE! It is finally enough. Legion is stricken. And dies. The Lanterns who have come to witness the unthinkable fea watch as Legion drops. The nightmare ended. The Corps’ surprise only outdone by their shock when they see --

still hanging in the sky... ile plummets. Lifelessly. He POUNDS into the ground at then foot of the CRACKED and SP battery. Sinestro and Tomar-Re are the first to reach him. The smo starts to clear, REVEALING... Hal. Unmoving. He is a hero today. And he is dead. At least, that’s what we think. Until... Hal shudders and coughs. Life returning. Beaten up... but still Hal.
(weak; @ la post-dogfight) Well... that was easy. Sinestro helps him to his feet. Hal’s temples are now GRE (Fanboys orgasm appropriately.)
You should be dead.
Don’t sound so disappointed. Sinestro turns to ALL THE LANTERNS who have assembled.

Hal Jordan of Gaia came here seeking our help and saved us instead. (then) Today we show him how the Corps defends its own. For he has proven he is one of us. If his planet needs help... it will find us ready. It will see a storm! The Lanterns CHEER! Raising their Rings in unison!
MUSIC BUILDS as SINESTRO, TOMAR-RE and KILLOWOG and a HUN OTHER LANTERNS rocket towards us, led by... GREEN LANTERN
Carol and Carl linger over the news reports of Senator Hammond's death played on several plasma screens --
...Senator Robert H. Hammond, astronaut and American hero is dead at 72... Carl runs a hand over the Sabre floor model.
He was our last shot at getting these off the ground. We could’ve saved lives...
We'll get the funding, Dad. Venture capital maybe. But Carl knows better. His dream... it’s over.

No. It’s time for me to get on with my life. And for you to finally have one. A hug that says he understands the sacrifices she’s made. Appreciative, holding her father, Carol is distracted by something in the distance: TOM slinking down to the shelt
I thought Hangar 18 was closed?
The old fallout shelter? It is. Why? Carol’s not sure either. Curiosity piqued, she beelines t
Carol is standing at the head of the metal staircase she spied Tom descending. She moves down it, through an old metal door, and into:  89.

Tom faces his bank of monitors/displays, so he doesn’t se CAROL push through the metal doors and down the stairs. S takes in the space and -- with an audible GASP -- Abin’s alien ship. Tom turns. Sees her. Shits.
Tom... Anything you’d like to tell me?
Carl moves through his workspace, flicking off the lights by one. He lingers over a Sabre model. Saying goodbye.

Sorry, Martin. Let you down again. A moment of regret. And Carl is suddenly SUCKED out of th showroom -- CRASHING THROUGH a glass partition -- into -- The hangar. He hangs in mid-air, floating above one of th SABRE PROTOTYPES, terrified by the sight of... A GARGANTUAN HEAD. It lists to one side, neck no longer a to support it fully. We PAN DOWN over the cracked and mottled scalp to recognize -- HECTOR. His body useless. He drools slightly. His hands tremble, curled into claws around the arm of a WHEELCHAIR pushed by haggard and disheveled BROOME, a hellish orderl
Excuse me. I’m looking for a Mr. Hal Jordan. You know where I can find him? Carl stares back, bloody and scared.
What are you -- ? Hector sighs, as if he’s being put out.
Not here? Hector looks over to Sabre. An idea flashes.
Fine. How about we bring him to us? His brow furrows and... the engine FOOMS to life.
Tom tap dances his way out of Carol’s question:
It’s a... prototype I’m working on, a cross-model design sorta thing, took some fuselages and... probably won’t even fly, I thought of it when I was stoned --
Do you honestly think I can’t recognize a SPACESHIP when I see one?!
(flinching) It’s not my fault -- just don’t hit me -- Before Carol can press, the room is ROCKED by a THUNDERCL from outside. Carol BOLTS out, Tom trailing, as --
-- THE ENTIRE FLEET OF SABRES pulls out of the hangar and TAKES OFF, soaring into the horizon.
We didn’t have a test flight scheduled for tonight, did we?
No! Carol and Tom race across the pavement back to:
Carol runs in -- Tom behind her -- but the sight of her father, writhing in mid-air, freezes them in their tracks
Dad--! Her gasp snares Hector’s attention. A MEMORY HIT: Carol’s face from Hal’s minds eye. Hector grins, “recognizing” he

I know you. Focusing on Carol, Hector’s brow furrows, using his new power. ANOTHER MEMORY: Carol in “Paris,” almost kissing G HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Hal Jordan. (re: his “condition”) This is his fault. It’s because of him I’m this... monster.
A pair of Sabres shoot over the coastline, BANKING toward homes and buildings.

So now I’m going to destroy every thing and everyone he’s ever loved... ...The U-CAVs align for a STRAFING RUN, birthing MISSILES SPITTING BULLETS! Architecture disintegrates. HECTOR HAMMOND (V.O.) (CONT’D) Starting with this crappy city...
Hector is eye to eye with Carol now.
..-and ending with you. While he watches. (off Carol’s terror) That okay by you?
Like the Santa Monica Pier of yesteryear. Boardwalk, Ferr Wheel, a world of taffy. Full of oblivious INNOCENTS. Hel Jordan laughs as Nathan pleads with his father:
(re: the Ferris Wheel) Just one more time.
You already had five ‘one more’ times.
Those didn’t count. Pleeeeeze? Who’s saying no to that kid?

Gorgeous beach views, stuffed with traffic in front of a TUNNEL (like PCH). Drivers HONK as -- BOOOOM! -- a wild FIREBALL EXPLODES out of the tunnel! FOUR SABRES FLY OUT of the fire, spinning to take aim at bridge. Cars EXPLODE and TUMBLE as the Overpass COLLAPSES
Another Sabre DEPLOYS. The quaint city center is no more! Coast City is being destroyed!
TIGHT ON HECTOR: Eyes rolling with the remote controlling the U-CAVs. Face exultant with the death he brings.
At the Ferris Wheel zenith. Jim’s bored out of his mind a Nathan presses his face to the gondola window, entranced.

Hey, Dad? (pointing) What're those? Jim glances up to see two SABRES bearing down on them! No time to panic or answer as -- the Sabres split, DIVING towards the base of the ride -- GUNS BLAZING -- The wheelhouse CRUMPLES! Metal cries in protest and... The entire structure starts to topple! Like a redwood fel and falling, casting its vast SHADOW on the ground... ove HELEN! Feet rooted by fear. NATHAN lets out a SHRIEK -- Jim pulls Nathan close as the fall -- it’s over -- Until the ENTIRE WHEEL is suddenly awash in GREEN LIGHT. Nathan and Jim open their eyes to see... A RHINO-SHAPED LANTERN. KILLOWOG. A FORCEFIELD from his Ring holding the wheel then setting it upright.
(to Nathan; a greeting) Poozer.
At which, the sky goes DARK. A SHADOW passes over Nathan' face, as he looks up to see... A SKY FULL OF GREEN LANTERNS! A storm to blot out the sun
ON HECTOR: Delighted. With a sick glance to Carol.
He’s here. And he’s brought friends.
THE LANTERNS split off like fireworks, streaks of emerald blazing in all directions to address Hector’s mayhem.
Killowog ring-welds the Ferris Wheel’s base secure.

One of the Sabres DECIMATES the rollercoaster’s TRACK. Th ‘coaster FLIES off the rails, about to CRUSH terrified bystanders before... being caught by a HUGE GREEN CLAW. Manifested by TOMAR-RE’S Ring. The Sabre comes around for another try... buzzing the boardwalk. The crowd FLEES, a TIDAL WAVE of people, but.. SINESTRO stands his ground, awaiting the Sabre’s approach like a gunfighter. THE OTHER LANTERNS crisscross over the city. One stops a LANDSLIDE with a GIANT GREEN SHOVEL. Another rescues a family from a collapsing building. A SCHOOL BUS is set ri after teetering over an overpass. The PEOPLE’S appreciation overwhelms their fear of the strange creatures saving them...

Sinestro and Hal, side by side, manifest the weapons that dispatched Legion, Scimitar and Samurai sword, and SLICE through the horde of U-CAVs flying right at them! Through the SMOKE they see two last Sabres coming at them Sinestro prepares, poising his scimitars.
The threat to your planet... surely it isn’t only these machines.
It’s not these... it’s who sent them. (realizing) Carol --
We have this. Go! With Sinestro to handle the Sabres, and the team of Lante to help those in need, Hal BARRELS at FULL SPEED to -- FE AIRCRAFT.

A human-sized bullet hole RIPS open as GL bursts through. searches. No sign of Carol. But -- TOM and CARL are held captive, lifted high above, a WHIRL of TOOLS and HEAVY EQUIPMENT SWIRLING around them dangero close. All by HECTOR... who’s slavering for the fight. A monster in a chair, his vile head housing his murderous m
You‘re late. I almost had to kill everyone without you. Hector tries to penetrate Hal’s mind with his own -- to CONTROL HIM -- but Hal’s aura shines brighter than ever.
Let them go.
Sure. With a raised brow... Carl and Tom go flying out the hang
THAT GREEN HAND catches Carl and Tom. Places them safely.

Annoyed, Hector FIRES the maelstrom of metal at GL -- who conjures a SHIELD to deflect it (A PIECE KNOCKS BROOME ba and unconscious). Hector’s chair wheels toward GL confidently. He makes a rag rise to wipe his sticky chin.

Nice. But not enough to save her... Your Carol. (knowingly) I could see you all over her mind... years of disappointment. Only to disappoint her now. One last time. Hal turns to Hector, rage in his eyes --

Every memory she had of you is filled with regret... the years wasted, waiting for you. You never did a thing for her until someone gave you that ring. (eyes lighting up at the RING) You don’t deserve all that power. Without that ring, you’re not a hero. You're barely even a man.
(through his teeth) Where. Is. She?

Relax. She’s right here. Hector glances over to that first Sabre prototype. GL’s e go wide when he sees... Carol. In the translucent PAYLOAD the U-CAV. Trapped. Pounding on the soundproofed plexi. Hector relishes the obvious pain on GL’s face. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Now from what I’ve seen of your childhood, you don’t have such a good history with plane crashes. Hector’s eyes close. The Sabre’s engines FIRE. NEARBY: The guidance computer LOCKS on a DESTINATION. A MOUNTAIN RANGE! The trajectory of Carol’s death plotted. t

HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) All that power and you can’t do a thing. You're paralyzed. Get it? (laughing, the point of it all) Now you know what it’s like to be me. The Sabre’s engines ready for take-off. GL steals a look back at Carol. Their eyes lock. Sympathy. Regret. GL can’t let her down. Not again.
But you don’t know what it’s like to be me. You want power? Real power? Just let her go. And I’1l give you this. He shows HIS RING. We fear for the choice he is making.
This Ring can give you more power than you knew existed. Its only limit is what you can hold in your mind. And your mind is a lot bigger than mine. Hector’s eyes light up at the thought.

With this you can do anything. Be anything. You can kill me as many times as you want. You can rule the world. (a final bargain) All you have to do is let her go. Hector considers the shiny offer. The WHINE of the Sabre’ engines MOUNTS. And finally -- SLOWING. It’s a deal.

Fine. Take her... In response, GL... removes his Ring. He opens his palm an the Ring FLOATS UPWARD. Pulled towards Hector by his mind As the ring leaves Hal, GL’s uniform dissolves. And... FOOM! THE SABRE TAKES OFF! With Carol still trapped insid (And before she could see GL’s true face.) HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT'‘D) Sorry. I lied. The ring flies to Hector’s hand. And the second it does - Carol BLASTS into the sky. Off to her death. Hector EXPLODES the GUIDANCE COMPUTER with his mind. Fear fills Hal’s face as he watches his love recede into the s he turns to see -- HECTOR -- as he --
The Ring GLOWS instantly with the connection. ENERGY BEAM all around. The LUCENT AURA LIGHTS AROUND HIM and...
i

He RISES from his wheelchair, the aura giving him the strength his body lacks... Hector’s eyes grow wide with rapture. His face ecstatic.. He knows now what true power is. A flick of his wrist and he makes the WALL EXPLODE with G LIGHTNING. Another and CRAGGLY CLAWED FINGERS (his versio of the Green Hand) RIP THE GROUND OPEN underfoot. SOMETHING GROWS out of the Ring. RIPPING THROUGH THE GROU

CONSTRUCT -- Hector has the exultant look of a man just named messiah. As Hector’s mountainous creation grows... its spires begi CHANGE, MORPHING into TENTACLES. The entire construct’s shape momentarily takes on the full form of
IT FLARES! Twisting and writhing. The Ring’s power is too much for Hector. There’s A FLASH OF WORRY on HECTOR’S FAC as the energy becomes TOO MUCH FOR HIM. Hal grins.
I lied, too. You weren’t chosen. Hector gets it now. He doesn’t possess the will to contro the Ring -- until finally -- The ENERGY SURGES BACK DOWN! Hector WAILS as all that ene FIRES BACK AT HIM.

head_text.subj: AN EXPLOSION OF LIGHT AND HEAT

text: And it’s all gone. Mangled, mutated Hector has fallen bac into his chair, twitching, cataplectic. And so he’ll stay Of its own accord THE RING zips off Hector’s finger and.. Flies right back into Hal’s hand. CLOCK! Broome gives Hector a WALLOP, straight to the jaw.
That’s for making me rob a bank, asshole! Broome looks up to thank his savior... but Hal is already BOLTING OUT -- chasing after Carol in the Sabre.
Running, Hal fits on the Ring. He extends his hand, ready fly -- BUT THE RING ONLY PULSES. IT HAS NO CHARGE LEFT. The Ring can’t help him anymore.
The Lantern!
He looks. His underground lair is a half mile off! And th Sabre is getting further away by the second... closer to
Hal looks around -- his eyes landing on something... and fills him with courage:
waiting on the tarmac! Without a second’s hesitation, HAL POUNDS FOR IT. TOM approaches, catching up --
What are you doing? Use your ring!
There isn’t enough time to charge it! She’s heading for the Maker Cliffs. It’s gonna crash!
What are you gonna do?
(as he climbs in the jet) Stop it.
How?!

I got the ride to figure that out. But he doesn’t need a ring. Just aman. Still a hero. As the canopy SLAMS SHUT -- EXT. SKY / INT. HAL’S F-16 - INTERCUT Carol’s flying prison sweeps into view, a runaway train. struggle muffled. She sees the CLIFFS coming up ahead -- fear doubles. She BASHES helplessly against the glass, as
swoops down in pursuit. He’s caught up to the Sabre -- ju a few feet behind Carol now. Hal swerves his F-16 ahead -

text: but the Sabre presses on relentlessly, making its straigh line for
From back in the TOWER -- TOM comes on the HEADSET:
Can you see her?
I can’t move it. Shut it down!

The system’s blown! It won’t respond. Hal tries again, BARRELLING over the U-CAV dangerously cl trying to PHYSICALLY PUSH IT DOWN. But the Sabre is able maneuver out of every move Hal can think of. And the CLIF are DEAD AHEAD! How the hell is he going to stop that thi
There’s nothing you can do.
I can’t let her die! Hal fights panic. Ghosts of old deaths haunting him.
I’m pushing her to the runway. I can do it! ON HAL. Inspired by his father’s memory. There's still on thing left. He races his plane in front of the Sabre --
Tom... What do you guess the blowback on an ejector is?!

A hundred feet easy at the speed you’re flying! PULLS a switch that ARMS A WARNING LIGHT. Tom reacts to w he sees on his display. Hal's “plan.” TOM (INTO HEADSET) (CONT’D) Hal? Nonono. You can’t do it! You’ll hit the jet, you'll both die! And without a single thought for himself, Hal YANKS a RED LEVER. Hard. In an instant --
I’m clear. Ejecting now -- I’m clear. Ejecting now --

head_text.subj: PLANE AND INTO THE SKY. HE JUST HIT THE EJECTOR SEAT

text: In an instant Hal’s PARACHUTE deploys and entangles onto SABRE. He SLAMS PAINFULLY AGAINST THE SIDE OF THE SABRE. CONTACT! Like he just jumped from one train car to anothe only at 10,000 feet and nearing the sound barrier! Hal pulls against the crushing WINDSHEAR up the ‘chute -- closer... His fingers SNAG the wing of the U-CAV. With impossible effort, he PULLS himself up to the nose. CAROL is POUNDING on the payload from the inside now. SCREAMING. And then she sees him. HAL JORDAN. What the fuck is he doing on her plane?

Hal sees the CLIFFS AHEAD -- they are SECONDS away from impact. He reaches for a PANEL on the top of the fuselage Digs in and... RIPS it open -- exposing a BUTTON. Which h PUNCHES! THE PAYLOAD CANOPY goes FLYING! Hal reaches in a pulls Carol up. Wind rips into them.
He grabs her, FALLING BACKWARDS! And -- THEY FALL. Above them the Sabre speeds off ahead -- and --

They may have been saved from that -- but they’re in FREE FALL. No Ring. No chute. Just Hal and Carol clutching eac other as they achieve bone pulverizing terminal velocity. Tumbling in each other’s arms... The air ROARING... The GROUND COMING UP FAST... Death is seconds away. They hold each other tight. The wind to painful too speak But they don’t have to -- they both know it. They have lo each other their whole lives. They love each other still. Nothing left to do, they clutch each other even harder an They kiss. A lifetime's worth of love shared in the one moment left before their deaths. The tenderest goodbye.

All life is connected. By love, by hope, by all the noblest instincts of the soul. If ever a kiss embodied those noblest instincts... it is one. All that passion unbridled... SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) The power drawn from that connection is what you see simply as “green.” The Ring feels it first. It SHIMMERS -- DRAWING FROM ALL POWER IN THAT KISS! The radiance spreads. Up his arm. Brightening... the AURA REKINDLING, enveloping them BOTH. his clothes recrystallizing back into... the uniform of:
Recharged! Hal/GL and Carol are so lost in their embrace. their kiss so long awaited... they don’t even notice THEY'VE STOPPED FALLING.

Hal/GL realizes. He looks to his Ring, which SHIMMERS. Carol opens her eyes. And looks. Exhilaration replacing terror as she sees it -- she’s being carried by the GREEN LANTERN. BY HAL. The pieces fall together. Life changes.
(hits him) I_knew it was you!
Yeah, right. He smiles, taking soft hold of Carol, and... FLYING acros the sky... HAL/GREEN LANTERN (0.S.) (CONT’D) How ‘bout we land in Paris? The blue sky MATCH DISSOLVES into the blue curtain of:
THE PRESIDENT is at the podium, addressing a standing-roo only crowd of MEDIA:

My fellow Americans. The past days have seen events so miraculous, they shatter every conception we have about ourselves... our world... our place in Creation. We can look on these wonders with fear... or we can find hope. A new beginning. To provide answers and to quell anxieties, I’d like to turn this briefing over to Special Counsel to the President... Mr. Alan Scott. A weathered older man steps to the podium. A familiar fac And, now, a NAME.
The President has given me the honor and solemn responsibility of making this announcement, one I suspect will be long remembered. (a beat, then) We are not alone in the universe.
THE LANTERNS use their Rings to repair the widespread dam PEOPLE marvel at the sight of ALIENS on Earth. Tomar-Re bristles his top fin, slightly offended.
For years now, we’ve known of a group of extraterrestrials who patrol our universe and keep it safe.
And we realize that we’ve caught up with our OPENING.
Impossible to imagine? No more impossible than when Columbus suggested the earth was round or when Copernicus posited that it orbited the sun.

head_text.subj: EXT/INT. OTHER CITIES ALL OVER THE WORLD

text: People stare at the impossible news projected there as we
There are heroes out there. And now, one of our own has joined them. One of us. Now one of them. CLOSE ON: GREEN LANTERN. ALAN SCOTT (V.O.) (CONT’D) A Green Lantern. Widen to REVEAL we're:
Green Lantern walks with Scott down a long concrete hallw
Nice speech.

I’ve known about the people you work for since I was... younger than you. Ever since, I’ve worked for the goverment. Helping them get ready for a day just like this... when this planet finds out it’s just a tiny pebble on a very large beach. (beat) And people need to know it’1l be okay when you’re gone.
I haven’t said I was going anywhere. Scott nods. Eyeing the Ring with a bit of... nostalgia?

The Ring came to you, so that’s your decision to make. But I’1l tell you this: If I could do what you can do... I wouldn’t stay here. I’d fly around this Universe, seeing things no human's ever seen... No one who wears one of those belongs to any one planet. You belong to the stars.
i
(sensing, re: The Ring) You've... worn it, haven’t you? A long silence. Then, through the haze of smoke and memor
One like it, a lifetime ago... (a sad smile) But it wasn’t mine to keep. I wasn’t chosen. Not like you. A story for another day/movie. The gruff returns.
What if there’s more trouble?
I'll contact you. The same way I used to contact your predecessor on occasion. A knowing wink. Man, this guy is cool as shit.
And Hammond?
Hammond? I wouldn’t worry about him... Pipe keys a pad to take them where they’re headed:
On a catwalk, overlooking the centerpiece of the facility STADIUM-SIZED CONCRETE-LINED LAB. Filled with -- ROW AFTER ROW of RATS and MICE in cages. As we saw before Experiments. At the far end --
HECTOR HAMMOND sits. Huge cranium, burned and shrivelled body. Utterly grotesque. No sign of life behind his eyes. Just another rat.
He doesn’t do much anymore.
Pipe offers GL his hand. And his advice: ALAN SCOTT (CONT’D) The stars are waiting, Jordan. Don’t screw it up. GL reacts. Scott knows his identity.
It’s not fair.
Hal, in uniform, stands with Carol and Tom. This is goodb Floating a few thousand feet up are Sinestro, Tomar-Re an OTHER LANTERNS. Tom stares a little too much.
You get to go off with them and I’m stuck here. I can’t even play games with aliens now, just seems like a rip off.
I got a surprise for you. GL FIRES his ring... into HANGAR 18. A RUMBLE and... ABIN SHIP RISES OUT! The ship HOVERS on its own. Fixed. The single greatest thing that ever happened to Tom.
It's flying! I have a space ship! That flies! Oh my god, I can visit you -- Tom hugs GL hard enough to hurt. Then makes way for... Carol. Time for her goodbye. Not an easy thing.

(to Tom) Can I get a minute. Tom moves to his hovering craft by the hangar. The Lanter in the sky fly off even higher. Into the upper atmosphere GL de-uniforms, suit shimmering back into clothes. Just H
Do me a favor. Give my family a good excuse why I left --
I will.
(missing her already) I could be gone awhile.
It’s okay. I’ll be here. Besides, you're worth the wait.
So are you. And her lips meet his in a kiss that shows an understandi words can’t. His Ring SHIMMERS with it. The SHIMMERING BRIGHTENS, MERGING INTO... PURE SUNLIGHT...
The Sun shines unobstructed. Surely The Brightest Day, as
Green Lantern comes up through the stratosphere. Where Sinestro alone waits for him. Hal takes a longing look do at the brilliant blue Earth. Sinestro senses Hal’s sadnes
It is a beautiful planet.
It’s everything I love.
(then) If we train you well, there will be a thousand planets you will love just as much. The promise of things to come. Of Adventure. Hal drinks i the Earth. One last look.
Then let’s go see ‘em. And with a smile... and an explosion of LIGHT... Two GREEN STREAKS PAINT The Blackest Night... And we end where we began. IN GREEN. End.
